text: Interleukin-12 is produced in response to infection with bacteria or parasites or to bacterial constituents such as LPS in monocytes / macrophages and dendritic cells , and also generated by the interaction between activated T cells and antigen-presenting cells via <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> CD40 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

text: In the present study , we have characterized the transcriptional induction of <extra_id_0> p40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation in a human B lymphoblastoid cell line , Daudi , and a human acute monocytic leukemia cell line , THP-1 .

text: Sequence analysis of the <extra_id_0> p40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter region identified two potential nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappaB binding sites conserved between mouse and human .

Electrophoretic mobility shift assay revealed that the potential NF-kappaB binding sequence which is located around 120 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site in murine and human <extra_id_0> p40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes formed an NF-kappaB complex with nuclear extract from Daudi cells stimulated by <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation .

Moreover , transfection of Daudi cells with the polymerized NF-kappaB binding sequence ligated to a thymidine kinase / <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) reporter plasmid greatly induced <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity , but transfection with the polymerized mutated NF-kappaB binding sequence did not .

These results suggest that the NF-kappaB binding site located around 120 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site in murine and human <extra_id_0> p40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter regions could be important for the <extra_id_0> p40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction by <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation via activation of NF-kappaB .
